metadata.title: CVE-2019-16869 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Netty before 4.1.42.Final mishandles whitespace before the colon in HTTPheaders (such as a "Transfer-Encoding : chunked" line), which leads to HTTPrequest smuggling.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-16869` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnetty-3.9-java - 3.9.9.Final-1+deb9u1build0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: netty: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
netty-3.9 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.9.9.Final-1+deb9u1build0.18.04.1').
